channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Utility companies are crying foul because tech giants like Amazon want to bypass the grid by plugging their data centers directly into power plants
item.description: Federal officials say fast development of data centers is vital to the economy and national security, including to keep pace with China in the AI race...

item.title: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek is threatening Nvidia’s AI dominance
item.description: A new AI model from Chinese company DeepSeek is undermining the AI boom's darling, Nvidia.

item.title: Stock Markets Drop as Investors Worry About DeepSeek and China’s A.I. Advances
item.description: Stiffer competition for the tech giants at the forefront of the artificial intelligence boom prompted investors to reassess the companies’ sky-high va...

item.title: Standoff at Ukrainian Procurement Agency Threatens to Disrupt Weapons Supply
item.description: Ukraine’s defense minister fired the head of a state agency that procured over $7 billion in armaments last year, citing “unsatisfactory” results. She...

item.title: Coca-Cola notches a Costco-sized win against Pepsi
item.description: It’s the first soda swap since 2013.

item.title: Live Updates: Gazans Make Long Trek Home as Cease-Fire Holds
item.description: Palestinians began arriving in northern Gaza, months after Israel ordered them to flee. The Israel-Hamas truce was holding after it appeared to falter...

item.title: As Europe closes door to ‘golden’ visa programs, Grenada launches invite-only program to offer citizenship to wealthy investors
item.description: "This model is a valuable way for countries to attract the investment and expertise they require."

item.title: 5 Dumpling Recipes in Time for Lunar New Year
item.description: Just in time for Lunar New Year, Cooking writers share the dumplings they love most, with recipes and videos for how to make them.

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard’s Unorthodox Path to Trump’s Intelligence Team
item.description: Ms. Gabbard grew up in a secretive offshoot of the Hare Krishna movement and has made a dizzying journey from conservative to liberal darling to Trump...

item.title: 3.8-Magnitude Earthquake Felt in Boston and Maine
item.description: There were no immediate reports of injuries or damage after the light but rare earthquake on Monday morning.

item.title: E.V. Owners Don’t Pay Gas Taxes. So, Many States Are Charging Them Fees.
item.description: States are using higher registration fees for electric cars to make up for declining fuel taxes, but some are punitive, environmentalists say. A feder...

item.title: Starbucks’s CEO Brian Niccol earned a $5 million bonus after one month on the job—and will collect another $5 million in March
item.description: Brian Niccol stands to earn $10 million in signing bonuses after a "dogged pursuit" to convince him to lead the company.

item.title: Displaced Palestinians Reunite With Loved Ones in Northern Gaza
item.description: Large numbers of Palestinians headed to the north of the Gaza Strip for the first time in months after Israel withdrew part of its troops from the Net...

item.title: Rising Prices Dashed Trudeau’s Promise to Canada’s Middle Class
item.description: While many issues turned Canadians away from their prime minister, the high cost of groceries and homes has become a chief grievance.

item.title: Sweden Suspects ‘Gross Sabotage’ After Damage to Cable Under the Baltic Sea
